briefdescription.para: Constructor for a vector of arguments, and the explicitSum parameter (if true, we do not execute for mergeTerms(), and the vector of arguments stays as it is.

parameterdescription.para: std::vector of arguments in the sum.
Tells if the sum is explicit or not, if it must stay as this explicit list of arguments or not.

briefdescription.para: Constructor with a left and right operands for the sum. The explicitSum variable has the same meaning as for the other constructor.

simplesect.para: True if the expression is indexed.
The index structure of the Indicial expression

detaileddescription.para:
This function tries to factor the Abstract wrt any factor. This will be more involved in calculation than the other factorizing function that takes the factor as a parameter. So this function must be used only if we don't know the factors we want at the end.
full
If true the factorization is recursive through all the Abstract.

briefdescription.para: Checks for index contractions in the product. Applies Einstein's summation convention and sums automatically repeated indices. This function is called after the construction in order to leave a correct expression.

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::vector< const Space * > &spaces, bool applyProp=true) const override
memberdef.name: getTransposed

memberdef.argsstring: (const Index &indexToReplace, const Index &newIndex, bool refresh=true) const override
memberdef.name: replaceIndex

briefdescription.para: For indicial expressions, this function searches indexToContract and replaces it with newIndex.

parameterdescription.para: Dummy new index that replaces indexToContract in the expression.

simplesect.para: True if the index has been found.

memberdef.argsstring: (std::vector< Index > const &indexToReplace, std::vector< Index > const &newIndex, bool refresh=true, bool flipped=false) const override
memberdef.name: replaceIndices

memberdef.argsstring: (const Space *brokenSpace, const std::vector< const Space * > &newSpaces, const std::vector< std::string > &indexNames) const override
memberdef.name: breakSpace

memberdef.argsstring: (Expr_info other, std::map< Index, Index > &constraints, bool keepAllCosntraints=false) const override
memberdef.name: compareWithDummy

briefdescription.para: Comparison disregarding name of dummy indices, i.e. the two expressions * are equals even if dummy indices have not the same names in *this and * expr.

parameterdescription.para: List of existing constraints between indices (it is modified in the function).

simplesect.para: True if expr == *this taking constraints into account.

detaileddescription.para:
Here if two Abstracts have the same name, the function will return true even if they are not mathematically equal. So beware not to name different things the same way.
expr
Abstract to compare.
True if the two Abstracts are the same (or have the same name).
False else.

briefdescription.para: Specialization of a Prod object to handle TensorElement objects in the product (apply contraction of indices etc).
